title: Another heavy metal legend has Paul Stanley's back, supports statement on "dangerous fad" of pushing trans agenda on kids
description:
We're having a heavy metal Monday. First, Kiss's Paul Stanley came out with a common sense statement about the dangerous fad of adults letting children choose their own pronouns and chop their genitals off. Now, Stanley has backup. Twisted Sister frontman Dee Snider has his back!

Three things you should know. One, Dee Snider is responsible for the mantra that got me through junior high and high school, "if it's not metal, it's crap." Two, "The Price" is a highly underrated song. Three, Snider is NOT on our side politically in the slightest. He's anti-MAGA using his hit "We're Not Gonna Take It" and pro-gun-control zealots using it.

It's possible the only issue he agrees with the right on is that maaaaaaaaybe trans activism has been allowed to go too far.

You know what? There was a time where I "felt pretty" too. Glad my parents didn't jump to any rash conclusions! Well said, @PaulStanleyLive https://t.co/G80uNyzD7M
— Dee Snider🇺🇸🎤 (@deesnider) May 1, 2023
You know what? There was a time where I "felt pretty" too. Glad my parents didn't jump to any rash conclusions! Well said, @PaulStanleyLive

Snider is referring to when he was a glam rocker. There was a point in American history when dudes would dress like girls and still manage to bag an above-average amount of chicks. The 80s were a strange time.

Here's the Paul Stanley statement Snider agrees with:

Normalizing it as some sort of natural alternative or believing that because a little boy likes to play dress up in his sister’s clothes or a girl in her brother’s, we should lead them steps further down a path that’s far from the innocence of what they are doing. With many children who have no real sense of sexuality or sexual experiences caught up in the ‘fun’ of using pronouns and saying what they identify as, some adults mistakenly confuse teaching acceptance with normalizing and encouraging a situation that has been a struggle for those truly affected and have turned it into a sad and dangerous fad.

In a world where finding common ground was a thing, or a world where there even was any common ground to find, a statement like this would be it. Let adults do what's right for adults. Leave kids alone. Cutting off your genitals should be treated at least on the same level as getting your driver's license or buying a pack of cigarettes.

Welcome to 2023. Where it's newsworthy that two metalheads were brave enough to say out loud they believe letting a preteen get life-altering, irreversible surgery might be ill-advised.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy's debate with Chuck Todd on gender goes off the rails when Chuck implies, "You're not a scientist"
description:
We have reached the "you're not a scientist" debate on gender. Vivek Ramaswamy says there are only two genders: male and female. Chuck Todd, with a straight face, asks him if he knows this "as a scientist." Because to the left, only a scientist has the background to tell you how many genders there are.

I'm almost impressed this is what the left is running with.

CHUCK TODD: Are you confident that you know that gender is as binary as you're describing it?@VivekGRamaswamy: I am.

TODD: Do you know this as a scientist?

RAMASWAMY: There are two X chromosomes if you're a woman and an X and a Y...

TODD: There is a lot of… pic.twitter.com/KyVZnASdmv
— Kevin Tober (@KevinTober94) April 30, 2023

Todd hit all the leftist classics. He accused Vivek of fanning the flames of division. He tried to make it about "health care." And my personal favorite, claiming that passing laws not allowing parents to trans their kids isn’t small government.

Vivek countered after every point with facts. Though since this is obviously the left's new line of attack, anti-woke scholar James Lindsay has a suggestion for others who find themselves in this debate.

A point for @VivekGRamaswamy and others:

Maybe you can and maybe you cannot explain sex (not gender) "scientifically," but the point is that nobody actually has to. Don't play the game.

"Gender isn't real, sex is. Nobody needs to be an expert to know what sex people are." https://t.co/UwnLcnWh5x
— James Lindsay, making shitheads mad (@ConceptualJames) April 30, 2023

Crowder and the gang had A LOT to say about this and much more on today's show.

title: Watch: Former child actor loses agent, role in Marvel movie for not letting himself get sexed up by the director
description:
Former child actor Matthew Lawrence shared a story that is both shocking (if you have morals) and not shocking (once you hear it's the entertainment industry) at the same time. On the Brotherly Love podcast he does with brothers and fellow actors Joey (whoa) and Andrew, the Boy Meets World star talked about a role he lost and getting dropped by his agent over it.

It was because he wouldn't let himself get sexed up by the director.

Former child star Matthew Lawrence says a Marvel Studios director propositioned him for sex in exchange for a role in the MCU.

Lawrence declined, and was then fired by his agency. pic.twitter.com/tI81BS5UD8
— Dataracer (@Dataracer117) April 30, 2023
I've lost my agency because I went to the hotel room -- which I can't believe they would send me to -- of a very prominent Oscar award-winning director, who showed up in his robe, asked me to take my clothes off and said he needed to take Polaroids of me and then if I did X, Y and Z I would be the next Marvel character.

It's weird. In 2000, a coworker had told me a story about his uncle who worked as an engineer in a recording studio. And how a now legendary rock star only got his record deal because of sucking someone's d*ck. I called bullshit. There was no way that could be true. There was no way it could be kept a secret.

This would have taken place in the 80s and could be dismissed as a seedier time. The first Marvel movie, Iron Man, was released in 2008. If Lawrence's story is as he says, this story would have taken place in only the past decade or so. Where auditioning in SOMEONE'S HOTEL ROOM is common practice in the entertainment industry.

You can see in Lawrence's expression as he shares the story how ridiculous it sounds to say out loud. But it's standard practice. The actor didn't want to take his clothes off. He lost the role AND he got fired from his agency which put him in that position to begin with.

Hollywood is what we say it is. A cesspool.

title: Watch: Little man got punished for wearing a "there are only two genders" shirt, so he goes off on his school board
description:
Twelve-year-old Liam Morrison believes in science. He believes in science so much, he wore a pro-science shirt to gym class. It said, "There Are Only Two Genders." No word if it also said "Change My Mind," but it would be cool if it did.

Liam was forced to have an “uncomfortable talk” with two adults who said his shirt was making people unsafe. Yes, words on a shirt. Morrison was not amused, and he made sure his school board knew it.

A 12-year-old in @MiddleboroughPS was allegedly sent home from school and told he’s making people feel unsafe for wearing a shirt that said “there are only 2 genders.”

Watch him destroy the school board 🔥 pic.twitter.com/hCBO5wXIgh
— Libs of TikTok (@libsoftiktok) April 30, 2023
I was told that people were complaining about the words on my shirt, that my shirt was making some students feel unsafe. Yes, words on a shirt made people feel unsafe. ... Are their feelings more important than my rights? I don’t complain when I see pride flags and diversity posters hung throughout the school; do you know why? Because others have a right to their beliefs just as I do.”

Wait, not yet.

"There are only two genders.'" Nothing harmful. Nothing threatening. Just a statement I believe to be a fact. I feel like these adults were telling me that it wasn’t okay for me to have an opposing view. Their arguments were weak in my opinion.

Okay, now.

Good for Little Dude. I don't love kids speaking out like this. I wish he could be home transforming his basement into one giant G.I.Joe battle like I was allowed to do when I was twelve years old. But to paraphrase a common phrase of other school kids, progressives started it.

And if you'll indulge me in staying the obvious thing out loud, had a kid has been told they couldn't wear a "Jesus is Gay" or "I'm not Trans (But My Xir Is)" shirt, this would be national news. The kid would have a residency on CNN and MSNBC and be presenting "Best Kiss" at the MTV Movie Awards.

description:

Gene Simmons let us down when he fell into schmaccine mandate insanity. Thankfully, there is Paul Stanley. The Star Child issue a statement on society pushing its trans agenda on children. Even worse, when parents who should know better are complicit.

pic.twitter.com/5Gvz6v5HUi
— Paul Stanley (@PaulStanleyLive) April 30, 2023
There is a BIG difference between teaching acceptance and normalizing and even encouraging participation in a lifestyle that confuses young children into questioning their sexual identification as though some sort of game and then parents in some cases allow it.

Correct. Just like there is a big difference between teaching acceptance and assigning Penthouse forum letters as reading assignments, or leading debates in class "Anal Sex: Spit vs.Lube." Granted those aren't life-altering surgery, but it all falls under the same spectrum.

Stanley went on to agree that there are individuals WHO AS ADULTS may decide reassignment is their needed choice. But some parents are turning this into a game.

Normalizing it as some sort of natural alternative or believing that because a little boy likes to play dress up in his sister’s clothes or a girl in her brother’s, we should lead them steps further down a path that’s far from the innocence of what they are doing. With many children who have no real sense of sexuality or sexual experiences caught up in the ‘fun’ of using pronouns and saying what they identify as, some adults mistakenly confuse teaching acceptance with normalizing and encouraging a situation that has been a struggle for those truly affected and have turned it into a sad and dangerous fad.

In a world where finding common ground was a thing, or a world where there even was any common ground to find, a statement like this would be it. Let adults do what's right for adults. Leave kids alone. Cutting off your genitals should be treated at least on the same level as getting your driver's license or buying a pack of cigarettes.

We don't live in that world. We live in a world with two groups of people. One group who believes in science, biology, and letting kids be kids. And another group who says that first group are a bunch of transphobes.

Thankfully for Stanley, he has enough f*ck you money like JK Rowling and Dave Chappelle to safely speak out. Those who don't run the risk of White House-endorsed physical attacks.
